snippet: Nearly one-third of the nursing homes in California have been cited for violations that cause death or life-threatening harm to patients, but the Federal Government ''generally took a lenient stance toward many of these homes,'' Congressional inve...
lead_paragraph: Nearly one-third of the nursing homes in California have been cited for violations that cause death or life-threatening harm to patients, but the Federal Government ''generally took a lenient stance toward many of these homes,'' Congressional investigators said today. Investigators from the General Accounting Office said Federal officials had been extremely reluctant to take action, even against nursing homes repeatedly cited for serious violations of Federal health and safety standards.
abstract: Congressional investigators contend that nearly one-third of nursing homes in California have been cited for violations that cause death or life-threatening harm to patients, but Federal Govt 'generally took a lenient stance toward many of these homes'; General Accounting Office investigators say Federal officials have been extremely reluctant to take action, even against nursing homes repeatedly cited for serious violations of Federal health and safety standards (M)

headline.main: Government Easy on Errant Nursing Homes, Investigators Say
